intro: Codonoboea serratifolia, commonly known as the serrated leaf codonoboea, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves with serrated edges and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
